result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie Lyle New was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charlie Lyle New is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charlie Lyle New was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Charlie Lyle New was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Charlie Lyle New was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Charlie Lyle New was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-No contact with victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

9:12 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Paul Zilles.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zilles has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Atty Zilles, will address at argument.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with one correction and no additions or deletions.   Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Zilles.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 3 - 1 year of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.
Count 4 - 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.
Count 5 - 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.
Count 6 - 5 years of Initial Confinement and 5 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-No contact with victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Restitution - $3,143.12.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants the defendant 580 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the sentences to be consecutive to each other.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 08-17-2015 09:00 am

10:16 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - will be a plea hearing and recites agreement, will plea to counts 3,4,5 & 6 on 2014CF121, with counts 1 & 2, 2014CM64 & 2015CM26 being dismissed and read-in and count 7 being dismissed and request for presentence investigation.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 3,4,5 & 6 on 2014CF121.  Court orders counts 1 & 2 on 2014CF121, 2015CM26 & 2014CM164 be dismissed and read-in and count 7 on 2014CF121 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Pre-Sentence investigation be completed and filed with the court within 60 days.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court will set for sentencing in approx 60 days.

Court adjourned at 10:26 a.m.

Fax Cover Sheet - Faxed to Dr Kent Berney w/required attachments
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason onf Mental Disease or Defect)

8:51 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

ARRAIGNMENT
Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Amended Criminal Complaint - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the counts and penalties.  Court finds probable cause on the Amended Criminal Complaint.  

Attorney Haase waives the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY and NOT GUILTY BY REASON OF MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  

Attorney Haase requests Dr. Kent Berney complete an evaluation.

Court directs matter be set for Status Hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.  Court orders an evaluation be completed on 2014CF121.

MOTION FOR BAIL REDUCTION
Argument by Attorney Haase - requests bond be modified to $1,500.00 Cash.  Objection by DA and makes argument.  Rebuttal by Attorney Haase.  Court denies motion.

Court adjourned at 9:00 a.m.

Court directs case be set for Bond Modification Hearing and Arraignment - to be held in 1 to 2 weeks.
